senses.sense_definition: A North American shrub of the heath family, also known as the deerberry.

examples.text: The <w>buckberry</w> grows wild in dry woodlands.
We gathered fruit from the <w>buckberry</w> bush to make jam.

senses.sense_definition: A type of huckleberry shrub found in the southern United States.

examples.text: Hikers in the Appalachians often encounter the <w>buckberry</w>.
This species of <w>buckberry</w> prefers the acidic soil of the mountains.

senses.sense_definition: The silver buffaloberry, a thorny shrub with silvery leaves and red berries.

examples.text: The <w>buckberry</w> is often used in landscaping for its unique foliage.
Native people traditionally harvested <w>buckberry</w> fruit for food.
